title.narrative: Chad Digitalization of Revenue Administrations and COVID-19 Response Project

description.narrative: The development objectives of Domestic Resource Mobilization and Management Project for Chad is to improve performance, processes, and transparency in key government entities for revenue mobilization. This project has three components. 1) The first component, Results-based Financing to Support Change Management in Customs and Tax administrations, has the flowing subcomponents: (i) Support the utilization of a unified taxpayers registry for enterprises; (ii) Support the gradual adoption of electronic filing by large taxpayers; (iii) Support the roll out of mandatory tax payment by large taxpayers through the banking system; (iv) Support the gradual adoption of pay-by-phone by Small Taxpayers; and(v) Reduction in the number of physical custom inspections of imported merchandise; (vi) Reduction in the release time for imported merchandise. 2) The second component, Technical Assistance to Strengthen Revenue Agencies, aims to provide specialized TA, including technical experts for each area of intervention, to improve transparency, and increase accountability of the tax and customs administrations, petroleum, and telecom for revenue mobilization and management. It has the following subcomponents: (i) Improve Tax Administration and Policy; (ii) Improve Customs Administration; (iii) Increasing Transparency and Accountability of the Recipient's Revenue Agencies; (iv) Address Fiscal Challenges and Improve the Oversight of the ICT Sector; and (v) Improve the Management and Control of Revenue Generation in the Petroleum. 3) The third component, Project Management and Coordination, aims to support the ST-PAMFIP—a dedicated Project Implementation Unit embedded in the MoFB—to undertake project management, in accordance with the World Bank's fiduciary and other guidelines, including incremental operating costs, equipment, training on fiduciary and project management issues, project

condition.narrative: The Recipient shall:(a) no later than three (3) months after the Effective Date: (i) have acquired and installed a computerizedaccounting software capable of correctly recording and automatically generating financial statements (interim and annual);(ii) have hired an external auditor; and (iii) hire an independent verification entity or independent verification entities,as the case may be (“Verification Entity”), with capacity and under terms of reference satisfactory to the Association, to beresponsible for preparing and providing DLR verifications reports in accordance with the Verification Protocol and the PIM,certifying the achievement of those DLRs indicated to be verified by the Verification Entity in the Verification Protocol; and (b)furnish the DLR verification reports to the Association in such scope and in such details as the Association shall request.

title.narrative: Increase in Tax and Customs revenue collection relative to non-oil GDP
Increase transparency of the SHT's operations in the petroleum sector

target.value: Audited financial statements of year (t-1) are published

title.narrative: Support the utilization of a unified taxpayers registry for enterprises (DLI)

target.value: The unified tax registry is operational

title.narrative: Establishment of unique identification number for enteprises for all administrations

baseline.value: Multiple taxpayers identification number are used across the administration

target.value: All administrations use the same identification number for taxpayers

title.narrative: Support the gradual adoption of electronic filing by large taxpayers (DLI)

baseline.value: 5 percent of large taxpayers file electronically

target.value: At least 20 percent of large taxpayers file electronically

title.narrative: Risk-based procedures and audits are adopted in tax and customs administration

target.value: Risk based audits procedures are adopted

title.narrative: Support the rollout of mandatory taxpayment by large taxpayers through the banking system (DLI)

baseline.value: 20 percent of large taxpayers use the banking syst

target.value: At least 100 percent of large taxpayers pay through the banking system

title.narrative: Ratio of risk-based audits performed on large and medium taxpayers
Support the gradual adoption of pay-by-phone by small tax payers (DLI)

baseline.value: 0 percent of small taxpayers use pay-by-phone

target.value: At least 20 percent of small taxpayers use pay-by-phone

title.narrative: Number of tax offices in N'Djamena in which SIGTAS upgraded version has been rolled out
Reduce the Number of Physical Inspections (DLI)

baseline.value: 100 percent of merchandise is subjected to multipl

target.value: No more than 50 percent of imported merchandise is physically inspected

title.narrative: Number of customs offices in which ASYCUDA upgraded version has been rolled out
Reduce release time for imported merchandise decreased (DLI)

baseline.value: 242 hours on average to clear imported merchandise

target.value: 190 hours on average to clear imported merchandise
